label: lem-structural-variance-contraction
name: Exponential Contraction of Structural Variance

parameters_detailed.kappa_W: Cloning operator Wasserstein contraction rate (from thm-main-contraction-full)

lambda_struct.description: Exponential convergence rate for structural variance

C_struct.description: Combined noise constant from both operators

cross_chapter_dependencies.description: Wasserstein contraction from cloning operator with N-uniform rate kappa_W and noise C_W = 4*d*delta^2
Foster-Lyapunov function with Wasserstein component contracting at rate kappa_kin

proof_structure.key_insight: Apply existing Wasserstein contraction theorems to centered (normalized) empirical measures
steps: Step 1: Apply cloning operator Wasserstein contraction (E[W_2^2(Psi_clone(mu1), Psi_clone(mu2))])
Step 2: Apply kinetic operator Wasserstein contraction (Foster-Lyapunov bound)
Step 4: Variance decomposition (Villani 2009, Theorem 7.17) to separate centered from total Wasserstein
Step 5: Exponential convergence via Foster-Lyapunov iteration

variance_decomposition.tilde_mu: Centered empirical measure (mean translated to origin)

mathematical_foundation.realization_level: Bounds hold for individual random realizations, then expectation taken
mathematical_foundation.metric: Wasserstein-2 distance W_2^2 on centered measures
mathematical_foundation.reference: Villani 2009, Optimal Transport: Old and New, Theorem 7.17 (variance decomposition)

interpretation: Structural variance (centered Wasserstein distance) contracts exponentially in expectation due to combined action of cloning and kinetic operators. Establishes convergence in second moment (E[W_2^2] -> 0), appropriate for HK metric framework.
